title: Chris Robinson - '2 CD Discography' [320k MP3]

                ------------------------------------------------------

This Magnificent Distance is Chris Robinson's second solo album, released on June 29, 2004.

This Magnificent Distance is a work that draws on the vast panorama of American music--rock, blues, folk, country, soul and elements of jazz--and Robinson personalizes it with compelling vocals, free-spirited melodies and vivid lyrics in which he looks inwards and at the world around him.

The album generated some praise from a variety of outlets. It earned a four-star review in the June/July issue of Blender, in which Clark Collis cited ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œthe singerÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s heartfelt howling and dynamite harmonica playing.ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ Harp magazineÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Jaan Uhelszki praised Robinson's ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œrebel-hearted romanticism, tales of ruined innocence, and the quest for personal liberationÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ (August 2004), while TracksÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ Holly George-Warren noted how ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œProminent keyboards and eloquent guitar work (by former Black Crowes guitarist Audley Freed, Robinson and co-producer Paul Stacey) make the bucolic ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“Girl On The Mountain,ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ the majestic ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“When the Cold Wind BlowsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ and the nostalgic ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“(Last of the Old Time) Train RobbersÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ sound like Fillmore East jam sessionsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¦A grittier mood envelops the harmonica-driven ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“Piece of Wind,ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢ in which Robinson's political convictions surface.ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½

New Earth Mud Band Members:

Chris Robinson - vocals, guitar, harmonica (2002-2004)
Paul Stacey - lead guitar, piano, vocals (2002-2004)
Jeremy Stacey - drums, percussion (2002-2004)
George Reiff - bass, vocals (2002-2004)
George Laks - keyboards, (2002-2004)
Audley Freed - lead guitar, vocals (2004)
Steve Distanislal - drums, percussion (2004)
Rob Barraco - keyboards (2004)
